posts._title: Antonio Mercero – La cabina AKA The Telephone Box (1972)
posts.title: La cabina
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: ‘A man gets trapped inside a telephone box. Onlookers unsuccessfully try to free him. Then the men from the telephone company arrive, but relief turns into puzzlement, then horror, as it transpires what they have in store for him.’ – Donald Fisk

posts._title: Milagros Mumenthaler – Abrir puertas y ventanas aka Open Doors, Open Windows (2011)
posts.title: Abrir puertas y ventanas
posts.excerpt: From Argentina, this film is called Abrir puertas y ventanas in Spanish, “To Open Doors and Windows.” And indeed the first time director, Milagros Mumenthaler, has a fixation on these two apertures: the camera is always catching a window or a door being gone through, opened, slammed. As has been remarked by others, it is …

posts.title: Student
posts.excerpt: The film is based on “Crime and Punishment” by Fyodor Dostoevsky. Action takes place in modern Kazakhstan. The film’s protagonist is The Student whose major at the university is philosophy. He rents a basement room from an old woman living in the suburbs and suffers from a permanent lack of money and loneliness. The Student …

posts._title: Sergio Castellitto – Venuto al mondo AKA Twice Born (2012)
posts.title: Venuto al mondo
posts.excerpt: After losing the husband with whom she shared profound love, Gemma escaped from the terrible siege of Sarajevo with her newborn child. Sixteen years later she returns to the city with her son so that he can visit the city of his birth and discover the father he never met.

posts._title: Aleksandr Sokurov – Peterburgskiy dnevnik: Mozart. Rekviem (2004)
posts.title: Peterburgskiy dnevnik: Mozart Rekviem
posts.excerpt: – Sokurov directed and filmed Mozart’s Requiem for the Rossica Choir in the wonderful hall of the St. Petersburg Philharmonic. Preceded by his student film, inspired by La Traviata. The first night of a performance of Mozart’s Requiem staged by Alexander Sokurov, with the Rossica choir from St. Petersburg, led by Valentina Kopylova-Pantchenko, took place …

posts._title: Alfred Zeisler – Der Schuß im Tonfilmatelier AKA The Shot in the Talker Studio (1930)
posts.title: Der Schuß im Tonfilmatelier
posts.excerpt: IMDB: During the shooting of a jealousy scene on a soundstage, one actress is murdered. Due to the fact that the male star of the movie had a relation with the victim and the female star is now his fiance, he is suspected by the police. Written by Stephan Eichenberg During the production of an …
posts.titleEnglish: The Shot in the Talker Studio

posts.title: Red Army Parade 1941
posts.excerpt: Quote: On November 7th a traditional parade of the Red Army on the occasion of 24th anniversary of the October Revolution took place on Red Square in Moscow. Army units were leaving for the Western front right from the parade.

posts._title: François Ozon – Dans la maison AKA In the House (2012)
posts.title: Dans la maison
posts.excerpt: A sixteen-year-old boy insinuates himself into the house of a fellow student from his literature class and writes about it in essays for his French teacher. Faced with this gifted and unusual pupil, the teacher rediscovers his enthusiasm for his work, but the boy’s intrusion will unleash a series of uncontrollable events.

posts._title: Tae-Yong Kim – You Are More Than Beautiful (2012)
posts.title: You Are More Than Beautiful
posts.excerpt: South Korean director Kim Tae-yong’s You Are More Than Beautiful is about a man hiring a young woman named Young-Hee to pretend to be his fiancée to try and show his ill father he is getting married. When his father slips into a coma he pays the woman at the hospital, but she slips into …

posts._title: Alireza Davoudnejad – Niaz AKA The Need (1992)
posts.title: Niaz
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: Two boys compete for one job they both desperately need. Awards: Won – 1992 – Crystal Simorgh Award – Best Film – Fajr Film Festival Featured in Film Magazine’s Best Iranian film lists of 2009 and 2008
